dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6504 IH: Protect American Gun Exporters Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Green of Tennessee (for himself, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Posey, Mr. Graves of Missouri, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Harris, Mr. Duncan, Mr. Alford, and Mr. Dunn of Florida) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit actions to carry out the Department of Commerce’s pause in the issuance of new export licenses for certain exports under the Commerce Control List.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect American Gun Exporters Act.

section.header: Prohibition on actions to carry out the Department of Commerce’s pause in the issuance of new export licenses for certain exports under the Commerce Control List

subsection.text: Effective beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Commerce—

paragraph.text: may not take any action to carry out the Department of Commerce’s assessment or any policy changes resulting from the assessment announced on October 27, 2023, relating to the Department’s pause in the issuance of new export licenses for exports of all items controlled under Export Control Classification Numbers 0A501, 0A502, 0A504, and 0A505 of the Commerce Control List; and
may not take any substantially similar action to pause or otherwise suspend or prohibit the issuance of new export licenses for exports of any or all items described in paragraph (1).

subsection.text: The Secretary of Commerce may take an action described in paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (a) only if—

paragraph.text: the action is subject to and meets the requirements of—

subparagraph.text: section 553 of title 5, United States Code; and
chapter 8 of title 5, commonly known as the Congressional Review Act); and

paragraph.text: before taking the action, the Secretary conducts a regulatory impact analysis of the action.
